intro: Manglilla venulosa, commonly known as the mangrove fern, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland and coastal areas, adapting to saline and waterlogged soils. Its root system helps stabilize soil and prevent erosion in mangrove ecosystems. Manglilla venulosa plays a vital role in supporting local biodiversity and maintaining coastal ecological balance.
